Key Arguments: The proposed legislation threatens the safety, wellbeing, democracy, and economy of Australia.
Social media platforms already unjustly censor personal views and scientific knowledge.
The legislation could silence important truths and personal experiences.
There is a belief that the government and social media platforms have hidden agendas.
The legislation could lead to increased oppression and censorship of diverse opinions.
Main Themes: Distrust in Government and Social Media
Notable Quotes: To silence truth is detrimental to society, to the individuals wellbeing in communities and those of their loved ones.
I say, 'Who are you to define what is truth and what is untrue and make the decision to censor my truths over what you pertain to be your own truths.'
ACMA do not have the wisdom to define truth in all concepts of life and society.
